subject: Is it the best method to unit-test for Divide class...PLS Help
msgSnippet: Divide Class package example.div; public class Divide { public int divide1(int x, int y) throws ArithmeticException{ if (y == 2) return x / y; else return x /
messageBody:
Divide Class


package example.div;
public class Divide {
public int divide1(int x, int y) throws ArithmeticException{
if (y == 2)
return x / y;
else
return x / y;
}
}


DivideTest Class

package example.div;

import static org.junit.Assert.*;

import org.junit.Before;
import org.junit.Test;

public class DivideTest {
Divide d = null;
@Before
public void setUp() {
d = new Divide();
}
@Test
public void testDivide() {
assertEquals(50, d.divide1(100, 2));
assertEquals("Result",100,d.divide1(100,1));
}
@Test(expected=ArithmeticException.class)
public void testDivide1(){
d.divide1(100, 0);
}
}
